prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation. 1. **Create Face 1:** a. **Loop 1:** i. Draw a line from (0, 0) to (0.375, 0). ii. Draw a line from (0.375, 0) to (0.75, 0). iii. Draw a line from (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.75). iv. Draw a line from (0.75, 0.75) to (0, 0.75). v. Close the loop, connecting the first and last points. b. **Loop 2:** i. Draw a circle with a center at (0.375, 0.375) and a radius of 0.1607. 2. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. 3. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D, using a normal extrusion depth of 0.0536, and an opposite normal extrusion depth of 0. 4. Extrude the sketch, and create the 3D model. This will form a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The height, width, and length of this part are 0.0536 meters, 0.75 meters, and 0.75 meters, respectively. Part 2: Cylindrical object with a tapered top 1. Create a new coordinate system with no rotation, located at the point (0.2143, 0.2143, 0). 2. **Create Face 1:** a. **Loop 1:** i. Draw a circle with a center at (0.1607, 0.1607) and a radius of 0.1607. 3. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.3214. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D, using a normal extrusion depth of 0.75, and an opposite normal extrusion depth of 0. 5. Extrude the sketch, and create the 3D model. This will form a cylindrical object with a tapered top, resembling a metallic tube. The height, width, and length of this part are 0.75 meters, 0.3214 meters, and 0.3214 meters, respectively. The final assembly consists of these two parts. The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole, and the second part is a cylindrical object with a tapered top. The cylindrical hole in the first part is slightly larger than the diameter of the second part. The cylindrical object is joined to the prism, with the tapered top facing outwards. The parts have a smooth surface, and the final shape is centered on a white background.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and parallel sides. The prism is tilted at an angle on the front face. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles as (0, 0, 0) and translation vector as (0, 0, 0). 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 1. Create a loop (loop_1) with 4 lines (line_1 to line_4) as follows: 1. line_1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.75, 0) 2. line_2: Start Point (0.75, 0), End Point (0.75, 0.3) 3. line_3: Start Point (0.75, 0.3), End Point (0, 0.3) 4. line_4: Start Point (0, 0.3), End Point (0, 0) 3. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, keeping the same orientation (euler angles as (0, 0, 0) and translation vector as (0, 0, 0)). 5. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.012 units towards the normal direction. 6. Set the height of the prism to 0.012 units. Set the length as 0.75 units, and the width as 0.75 units. Part 2: Angled Sloped Front Attach a sloped front to the previously constructed rectangular prism. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles as (0, 0, 0) and translation vector as (0, 0, 0.012). 2. Draw 3 independent 2D sketches on faces 1, 2, and 3 of the coordinate system. * Sketch on face 1 has the same orientation as the base part. * Sketch on face 2 is offset by 0.2367 units from the start point on the x-axis. * Sketch on face 3 is offset by 0.5133 units from the start point on the x-axis. 1. Create a loop with 4 lines for each sketch, similar to the base part. 3. Scale the 2D sketches using a scaling factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketches into 3D sketches, maintaining the same orientation and offset. 5. Extrude all 3 2D sketches simultaneously by 0.04 units towards the normal direction, merging the result with the existing prism. Thus, you will create a final shape with a flat top and bottom, parallel sides, and an angled front face. The sides are symmetrical along the central axis and meet the front face at an angle. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units, with the height being 0.04 units more than the base part.</description>
